explanation:
1) charsequalcaseless — The target calls this helper. To decide if any pointer should be const-qualified you must know its prototype/signature (parameter types and whether it expects or returns pointers). That confirms the target is passing plain char values (no pointer-to-non-const) and whether any pointer-to-data is forwarded that would require const qualification.  
2) bool — The function return type uses bool; the concrete typedef/definition (from stdbool.h or project typedef) is needed to ensure it is not a macro or typedef that affects pointer/const analysis and to confirm no hidden pointer typedefs are involved.  
3) size_t — The token_len parameter uses size_t; provide its typedef (from stddef.h or project headers) to confirm it is an integral type and not a pointer alias that would change the const-pointer analysis.

Providing these symbols (prototypes/typedefs) lets the next agent verify every pointer parameter/argument type the target uses and determine if any non-const pointer should in fact be const-qualified under the MISRA rule.
